{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = Linksys_WRT54G2.jpg |image1_size = 200px |caption = Wireless-G Broadband Router with Speed Booster |caption2 = |pp = |sp = http://support.linksys.com/en-us/support/lbc/WRT54GS2 |dl = |fandom = Linksys_WRT54GS2_v1.0 |wikidevi = Linksys_WRT54GS2 |wikipedia = |ddwrtsupport = Supported |openwrtsupport = no2mb |tomatosupport = no2mb |gargoylesupport = Incompatible |brand = Linksys |model = WRT54GS2 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v1.0 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 08/14/2010 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Linksys_WRT54GS2_v1.0 |wlclass = G54 |series = WRT54GS2 |type = wireless router |sernum = CUQ01 |fcc_id = Q87-WRT54G2V1 |icid = 3839A-WRT54G2V1 |us_id = |boardid = 3763-14143002R |ecc_id = |cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM5354;BCM5354KFBG HK0906 P13 909737 R2 (BCM5354 chip rev 3 SoC) |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS |cpu1_type_rev = BMIPS3300 (R1) |cpu1spd = 240 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX29LV160CTTC-70G;MX S0B4220 29LV160GTTG-70G 3A325600; |flash1size = 2 |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY57V641620FTP-7;844A C HY57V641620FTP-7; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = 32 |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:23:69, 68:7F:74 |oui = 00:23:69, 68:7F:74 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = BSP;;; |stockos = VxWorks;;; |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes; 12-pin header; unpopulated |jtag = yes; 5-pad header; unpopulated |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = linksys |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = 6 |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |tpfirmware = DD-WRT |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 01/23/2008 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = none, internal |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "3763-14143002R" is silkscreened on the board. Same hardware as [[Linksys WRT54G2 v1.3|WRT54G2 v1.3]] ==Links of Interest== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_WRT54G_series Listed on the WRT54G series page on Wikipedia] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT54G2_v1.3_%26_WRT54GS2_v1.0 On the DD-WRT wiki] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=52245 wrt54gs2 v.1 router - DD-WRT forums] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=60720 Linksys WRT54G2 v1.3 & WRT54GS2 v1.0 Now Supported] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/datasheet/WRT54GS2_V10_DS_NC-WEB,0.pdf Datasheet.pdf] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/quickinstall/WRT54GS2_V10_QI_NC-WEB,1.pdf Quick Install.pdf] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/userguide/WRT54GS2_V10_UG_NC-WEB,1.pdf User Guide.pdf] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing DD-WRT=== {{DDWRTNotice|microreq}} {{DDWRTNotice|k24req}} {{DDWRTNotice|norevert}} Supported by dd-wrt as of = Nov 05, 2009 *[[dd-wrt-wiki:Linksys WRT54G2 v1.3 & WRT54GS2 v1.0#Flashing the Linksys WRT54GS2V1|Linksys WRT54GS2 v1.0]] # Configure your computer's local lan ethernet address to 192.168.1.10, subnet 255.255.255.0, gateway 192.168.1.1 . Then connect an Ethernet cable to your computer and port 1 of your router. '''(Do Not Use Wireless)(Nothing else connected to router)''' # Perform a [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|Hard reset or 30/30/30]]. # Open your browser to http://192.168.1.1. # Use the firmware upgrade dialog to flash [http://www.dd-wrt.com/dd-wrtv2/downloads/others/eko/WRT54GS2V1%20Flashing/VxWorksKiller-GS2V1.bin Vxworkskiller-GS2V1.bin]. # WAIT for at least five minutes before you continue! (longer is better) Give vxworks killer plenty of time to do its magic! # You will not be able to browse the WRT54GS2v1 at this point, but you should be able to ping 192.168.1.1. If the router doesn't reply you haven't set your computer's network settings correctly (on step 1) # Tftp the DD-WRT firmware to the router, use latest [http://www.dd-wrt.com/dd-wrtv2/downloads/others/eko/WRT54GS2V1%20Flashing/dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin] from the folder where you got these instructions; after sucessful tftp, wait 5 min for the router to finish writing new nvram deafults, etc... It should reboot on its own at least 2 times, so give it 5 min and then go to http://192.168.1.1 (If it not reboot on its own, wait another 2 min, and then power cycle it) , you should see the password reset page. Don't worry about changing it at this point. # Perform a [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|Hard reset or 30/30/30]]. # WAIT for at least 5 minutes before you continue! (longer is better) Give the router plenty of time to to boot. # Browse 192.168.1.1, you should see the password reset page, change it! Then configure. # Check for recommended builds [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT#Recommended Builds|here]]. ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==Reverting== ===Reverting to OEM Firmware from DD-WRT=== {{DDWRTNotice|norevert}} ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== 
 nTRST  1o o2  GND
   TDI  3o o4  GND
   TDO  5o o6  GND
   TMS  7o o8  GND
   TCK  9o o10 GND
 nSRST 11o o12 N/C
'''Using [[TechInfoDepot:JTAG/TIAO/Universal JTAG User Manual (Parallel)|Universal JTAG Adapter]]''' 
  white  1o o2  black
    red  3o o4  GND
   blue  5o o6  GND
  green  7o o8  GND
 yellow  9o o10 GND
 orange 11o o12 N/C
* /noreset switch required ====DD-WRT JTAG Recovery==== [[Project:JTAG/TJTAG|JTAG]]: # Backup CFE x2 (Compare the files, they must match exactly or there is something wrong with your JTAG setup) # Erase Wholeflash x2 # Flash CFE # Unplug Power # Unplug JTAG Cable [[Project:DD-WRT/TFTP flash#Linksys TFTP GUI|TFTP]]: # Set Rig ip static 192.168.1.10 # Plug network cable from rig to port 1 # Get TFTP ready, server ip - 192.168.1.1, Password - blank, file - [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/older/12-28-09-r13525/broadcom/dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin] # Plug in power # As soon as windows says "connected" hit upgrade. May have to use a network hub to make sure windows is always connected. # Hard Reset 30\30\30 ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
 VCC 1 o
  TX 3 o
  RX 5 o
 N/C 7 o
 GND 9 o
====DD-WRT Serial Recovery==== {{Modified redhawk0 instructions|wrt54gs2}} ==Pictures==
